page.title: 06INDUSTRY BOILER MAKING
page.content: {McEWEN'S BOILERS At McEwen's Boilers they use a lot of hand tools,such as dividers,spirit levels,protractors,cold chisels and a corking machine.The tools have sometimes to be made at the shop because they cannot be bought.They use only one type of metal,it is called Carbon Steel.They buy it in tubes and flat sheets. They have to shape the metal at their workshop.There are only five employees,but they have to be hard working.They make about three boilers each month,but this depends on how big the boilers need to be.Most of the electrical parts are done by a local electrician,Mr West.The business has been going for about seven years.Boilers are made to fit.The carbon steel sheets are shaped and drilled using patterns and joined to make the boiler the required shape.
